item.title: 尽管特朗普言辞激烈，美国经济增长仍令达沃斯再次惊艳
item.description: 美国史上最大规模的官方行动旨在给达沃斯与会者留下深刻印象，尽管人们普遍对美国总统的扩张野心感到担忧，但与会者们仍纷纷发表了经济乐观言论。【原文：America’s biggest-ever official effort to impress the Davos crowd was matched with words of economic optimism from attendees, notwithstanding wider alarm at its president’s expansive ambitions.】

item.title: TikTok展现美国人进入"中国式健康习惯时代"
item.description: 网民们纷纷上传记录自己"中国式生活"的视频，并积极践行喝温水等健康习惯。【原文：Internet users are posting videos of their ‘Chinese era’ and embracing practices like drinking warm water.】

item.title: 奈飞在竞购战中提高对华纳兄弟的报价条件，改为全现金收购
item.description: 奈飞公司已达成修订后的全现金收购协议，将收购华纳兄弟探索公司的影视制作及流媒体业务。该公司正与派拉蒙天舞公司展开竞争，争夺这家好莱坞最具标志性的娱乐公司之一。【原文：Netflix Inc. reached an amended, all-cash agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc.’s studio and streaming business as it battles Paramount Skydance Corp. to acquire one of Hollywood’s most iconic entertainment companies.】

item.title: 迪拜环球港务集团调查显示：全球贸易将穿越不确定性
item.description: 尽管面临关税逆风，企业高管仍看好供应链韧性及中国出口稳健表现【原文：Despite tariff headwinds, executives see resilience in supply chains and solid Chinese exports】

item.title: 英国企业被迫清算数量升至2012年以来最高水平
item.description: 去年英国被迫清算的企业数量攀升至十余年来最高水平，高企的税负与严峻的经济前景令企业举步维艰。【原文：The number of UK firms forced to liquidate rose to the highest level in more than a decade last year, as higher taxes and a challenging economic outlook weighed on businesses.】

item.title: 日本债券市场突发崩盘，引发全球交易大厅动荡
item.description: 日本7.6万亿美元债券市场的抛售最初缓慢展开，随后似乎突然全面爆发。【原文：The selling in Japan’s $7.6 trillion bond market began slowly, then seemed to hit all at once.】

item.title: 日本正推高全球债券收益率
item.description:
日本部分政府债券收益率时隔三十余年首次突破4%。

【原文：

The yield on some Japanese government debt is above 4% for the first time in more than three decades.

】

item.title: 马哈拉施特拉邦力争在达沃斯论坛上超越去年投资承诺
item.description: 印度工业化程度最高的邦之一的首长在达沃斯表示，该邦预计将超越去年创纪录的投资承诺额，以巩固其作为顶级商业目的地的地位。【原文：The chief minister of one of India’s most industrialized states said in Davos that it expects to surpass last year’s banner showing in investment pledges, as it seeks to reinforce its position as a top destination for business.】

item.title: 野村证券遭阿达尼关联基金起诉，该基金被做空报告指控
item.description: 野村控股公司向某投资基金提供的贷款正面临伦敦诉讼的审查，该基金卷入了一家做空公司对印度亿万富翁高塔姆·阿达尼的指控。【原文：Nomura Holdings Inc.’s loans to an investment fund embroiled in a short-selling firm’s allegations against Indian billionaire Gautam Adani have come under scrutiny in a London lawsuit.】

item.title: 欧洲央行委员维勒鲁瓦认为贸易紧张局势对价格影响有限
item.description: 欧洲央行管理委员会成员弗朗索瓦·维勒鲁瓦·德加洛表示，不断升级的跨大西洋贸易紧张局势对通胀前景影响有限。【原文：Escalating transatlantic trade tensions won’t have much impact on the inflation outlook, according to European Central Bank Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau.】

item.title: 在与华纳的竞争中，奈飞业绩将揭示基本面状况
item.description: 尽管近日围绕奈飞公司的讨论都聚焦于其对华纳兄弟探索公司开出的天价收购要约，但当这家流媒体巨头在盘后公布财报时，华尔街将有机会将目光投向其他领域——至少在短时间内如此。【原文：While the chatter surrounding Netflix Inc. these days is all about its hefty bid for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., Wall Street will get an opportunity to focus on something else, at least for a little while, when the streaming giant reports earnings after the bell.】

item.title: 科技投资者称：欧洲必须投资开源人工智能，否则将让位于中国
item.description: 谷歌前首席执行官、科技投资者埃里克·施密特表示，欧洲必须投资建设自己的开源人工智能实验室，并应对能源价格飙升的问题，否则很快就会发现自己依赖于中国模型。【原文：Europe must invest in its own open source artificial intelligence labs and address soaring energy prices, or it will quickly find itself dependent on Chinese models, former Google chief executive and tech investor Eric Schmidt said.】

item.title: 债券发行方谨慎回归，因格陵兰紧张局势加剧
item.description: 周二，部分借款人重返欧洲债务市场，但另一些借款人仍因格陵兰问题与美国关系紧张而保持观望。【原文：Some borrowers ventured back into Europe’s marketplace for debt on Tuesday, though others are still staying away amid tensions with the US over Greenland.】

item.title: 加纳矿商警告：提高黄金特许权使用费可能威胁投资
item.description: 加纳矿业界警告称，政府提议提高对黄金生产商征收的特许权使用费，可能阻碍投资。【原文：Ghana’s mining industry warned that a government proposal to increase the royalty levied on gold producers could deter investment.】

item.title: 贸易动荡冲击新兴市场涨势，收益率攀升
item.description: 新兴市场股市下跌，因日本债券抛售潮及美欧因格陵兰问题爆发贸易战的预期削弱了全球风险偏好。【原文：Emerging-market stocks slipped, as a selloff in Japanese bonds and the prospect of a US-Europe trade war over Greenland sapped global risk appetite.】

item.title: 泰国取消外汇汇回限制以抑制泰铢升值
item.description: 泰国正放宽将境外收入汇回国内的限制，将汇款门槛提高十倍，当局正加大力度抑制泰铢汇率，该货币目前交易价接近五年高位。【原文：Thailand is loosening rules on bringing foreign earnings home, lifting the threshold by tenfold as authorities step up efforts to rein in the baht, which is trading near a five-year high.】

item.title: 伦敦金属交易所现货铜价飙升，交易商争抢库存
item.description: 伦敦金属交易所现货铜价飙升至高于远期期货价格，这表明交易商可能正着手从该交易所仓库中提取大量库存。【原文：Spot copper prices surged above later-dated futures on the London Metal Exchange in a sign that traders may be moving to withdraw large volumes of stock from the bourse’s warehouses.】

item.title: 据称德意志交易所即将以53亿欧元收购Allfunds
item.description: 据知情人士透露，德意志交易所集团正接近达成一项协议，将以约53亿欧元（62亿美元）的现金和股票收购欧洲基金分销平台Allfunds集团。【原文：Deutsche Boerse AG is nearing a deal to acquire European fund distribution platform Allfunds Group Plc for about €5.3 billion ($6.2 billion) in cash and stock, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英格兰银行行长贝利警告特朗普攻击美联储将引发连锁反应
item.description: 英格兰银行行长安德鲁·贝利警告称，美国总统唐纳德·特朗普攻击美联储独立性的行为存在"重大"外溢风险。【原文：Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey warned of the “substantial” threat of spillovers from US President Donald Trump attacking the independence of the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 据称Quantinuum正与摩根士丹利、摩根大通合作推进首次公开募股事宜
item.description: 据知情人士透露，量子计算公司Quantinuum正与摩根士丹利和摩根大通合作筹备首次公开募股。【原文：Quantinuum, a quantum computing company, is working with Morgan Stanley and JPMorgan Chase & Co. on an initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普让全球股市重现辉煌，而美国股市却落后于世界市场
item.description: 在标普500指数于四月从熊市边缘反弹后，全年持续刷新纪录。特朗普总统将此视为他已将美国——用他惯用的说法——打造为全球"最火"国家的明证。【原文：After the S&P 500 Index rebounded from the brink of a bear market in April and spent the remainder of the year going from one record to the next, President Donald Trump billed it as a sign that he had transformed the US — as he likes to put it — into the world’s “hottest” country.】

item.title: 肯尼亚管道公司IPO后资本支出将增至8.52亿美元，增幅达三倍
item.description: 肯尼亚管道公司是该东非国家计划通过首次公开募股上市的国有企业，该公司计划将项目资本支出增加两倍，以扩大管网规模、增加储气能力并拓展天然气业务。【原文：State-owned Kenya Pipeline Co., which the East African state is listing through an initial public offering, plans to triple capital expenditure on projects to widen its network, increase storage and diversify into natural gas.】

item.title: 索尼将把Bravia电视控制权移交给中国TCL电子
item.description: 索尼集团公司正将其家庭娱乐业务（包括旗舰品牌Bravia电视）的控制权剥离给中国竞争对手TCL电子控股有限公司，成为最新一家削减低利润业务的日本企业。【原文：Sony Group Corp. is spinning off control of its home entertainment business, including the flagship Bravia television brand, to Chinese rival TCL Electronics Holdings Ltd., the latest Japanese company to cut exposure in the low-margin segment.】

item.title: 德国投资者信心跃升至逾四年最高点
item.description: 德国投资者信心指数飙升至2021年中期以来最高水平，政府推动的支出举措正助力陷入困境的制造业摆脱低迷状态。【原文：German investor optimism surged to its highest level since mid-2021 as a spending push by the government helps pull the struggling manufacturing sector out of a malaise.】

item.title: 欧盟财长讨论动用贸易工具应对美国威胁
item.description: 欧洲各国财政部长正商讨动用欧盟反胁迫贸易工具及其他经济反制措施，此前美国总统特朗普因格陵兰岛争端宣布加征新关税。【原文：European Finance Ministers are discussing using the bloc’s anti-coercion trade instrument and other economic countermeasures following US President Donald Trump’s announcement of new tariffs over the Greenland dispute.】

item.title: BofA Survey Shows Investors Are Unprepared for Stock Correction
item.description: This week’s sudden stock market pullback might be catching a lot of investors off guard.

item.title: 沙特阿美首席执行官称，2025年人工智能相关财务收益将大幅增长
item.description: 沙特石油巨头沙特阿美预计，到2025年，通过运用人工智能和先进技术，其财务收益将超出预期。该公司将受益于钻井和维护成本降低、油井生产效率提升等节省措施。【原文：Aramco sees greater than expected financial gains from the use of artificial intelligence and advanced technology in 2025 as the Saudi oil producer benefits from savings like lower drilling and maintenance costs and greater productivity at its wells.】

item.title: Diamonds Face Lasting Period of Depressed Prices, Botswana Warns
item.description: Botswana is resigned to a prolonged period of weak diamond prices with serious implications for the budget of the southern African nation, where the gems are a vital source of income.

item.title: Dollar Hits Two-Week Low as Tariff Threats Stoke Volatility
item.description: The dollar fell to its lowest level in two weeks and currency hedging costs climbed as President Donald Trump showed no signs of backing down in his campaign for control of Greenland and threatened new tariffs on France.

item.title: Equatorial Guinea Offers Oil, LNG Prepay Deals to Energy Traders
item.description: Equatorial Guinea, OPEC’s smallest member, has turned to commodity trading companies for prepayment deals on oil and liquefied natural gas to help finance a revival of domestic hydrocarbon production.
